Service: SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines

Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, availability, and security. Identify the applications and services that will use the SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines.
Choose the appropriate Azure Virtual Machine size and configuration based on the database workload requirements, including CPU, memory, and storage.
Design the database architecture, including high availability, disaster recovery, and backup strategies. Plan for SQL Server Always On availability groups if needed.
Deploy the Azure Virtual Machine with SQL Server pre-installed or install SQL Server manually after provisioning the VM.
Set up SQL Server configurations, including authentication modes, database collation, and server-level settings.
Enable security features such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), SQL Server auditing, and firewall rules. Configure Azure Key Vault for managing encryption keys.
Configure automated backups using Azure Backup or SQL Server native backup tools. Test restore procedures to ensure data recovery capabilities.
Test and validate the integrity of database backups to ensure they can be restored successfully in case of data loss or corruption.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS). Configure alerts for performance metrics, availability, and security events.
Review SQL Server logs for errors, warnings, and other critical events. Address any issues identified in the logs promptly.
Perform performance testing and validate connectivity to ensure the SQL Server meets the required specifications. Test failover scenarios if high availability is configured.
Document the SQL Server setup, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training to the operations team for ongoing management and troubleshooting.
Ensure the SQL Server setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Configure auditing and logging to track database activities and security events.
Conduct regular audits of database security settings, including user permissions, firewall rules, and encryption configurations.
Regularly review and optimize database performance by analyzing query execution plans, indexing strategies, and resource utilization.
Apply updates and patches to SQL Server and the underlying Azure Virtual Machine to ensure security and stability.
Perform regular health checks on the SQL Server and Azure Virtual Machine to ensure optimal performance and availability.
Track disk space usage on the virtual machine hosting SQL Server to prevent storage-related issues. Expand storage as needed.
Set up and maintain high availability solutions such as Always On Availability Groups to ensure database resiliency and minimize downtime.
Review and update SQL Server configuration settings to align with best practices and changing application requirements.
Perform regular tests of the disaster recovery plan to ensure databases can be restored and operations resumed in case of a major failure.
Keep documentation up-to-date for SQL Server configurations, maintenance procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
Provide training to database administrators and users on SQL Server best practices, security measures, and troubleshooting techniques.
Ensure SQL Server licensing is compliant with Microsoft policies and meets the organization's requirements.
